intro: Agathosma mucronulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf buchu, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring, and it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves contain essential oils, which contribute to its use in herbal remedies and as a source of natural compounds. Agathosma mucronulata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
